docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Welcome to the documentation for hikari-ongaku, a library, that handles the discord voice server for you.

Not sure what to do? Check out Getting Started for examples on how to setup a bot!

docs.title: Ongaku
docs.text:
Ongaku(
    bot: hikari.RESTAware,
    *,
    host: str = "localhost",
    port: int = 2333,
    password: str | None = None,
    version: enums.VersionType = enums.VersionType.V4,
    max_retries: int = 3
)

The base class for your Ongaku handler

Parameter Type Description Default bot hikari.RESTAware The bot that Ongaku will attach too. None host* string The IP/host of the lavalink server you wish to connect to. "localhost" port* int The port of the lavalink server you wish to connect to. 2333 password* str, None The password to the lavalink server you wish to connect to. None version* VersionType The version of the lavalink server you wish to connect to. VersionType.V4 max_retries* int The maximum amount of retries the server will attempt when the connect() 3

Info

* means it is an optional marker, and will have a default

docs.title: connect
docs.text:
connect(
    user_id: hikari.Snowflake
)

Allows for the bot to actually connect to the lavalink server.

Parameter Type Description Default user_id hikari.Snowflake The User ID for the discord bot. None

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text:
Getting Started with Ongaku.

In the following documents, you will learn how to work with ongaku, from its most basic features, to its more advanced features.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
To install Ongaku, simply run the following:

pip install hikari-ongaku

docs.title: Basic setup
docs.text:
All bots that use Ongaku, require the following basics.

  • Gateway Bot
  • Ongaku
  • Starting Event

docs.title: Gateway Bot
docs.text:
you must have a gateway bot, like any other hikari discord bot. This library is compatible with all hikari command handlers.

import hikari

bot = hikari.GatewayBot(
    token="..."
)

bot.run()

docs.title: Ongaku
docs.text:
You now must make the ongaku class, and attach it to hikari.

import ongaku

lavalink = ongaku.Ongaku(
    bot,
    password="youshallnotpass"
)

docs.title: Starting event
docs.text:
Finally, you must have the starting event.

@bot.listen(hikari.events.StartedEvent)
async def started_event(event: hikari.events.StartedEvent):
    await lavalink.connect(
        bot.get_me().id
    )

docs.title: Thats it!
docs.text: After doing all of that, you can now officially start the bot, and have a connection to your lavalink server. For actually playing audio, check out the commands for more information.
